intro: Dilema, commonly known as the common dilemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
